gurmukhi: rxM suMD swvMq BwvMq gwjy ] qhw qUr ByrI mhw sMg bwjy ]
transliteration: Ranan Suddh Saavant Bhaavant Gadje|| Tahaa Toor Bherimahaa San Baaje||
translation: The warriors thundering in the battlefield and the kettledrums and conches etc. sounded there;

gurmukhi: BXo auc kolwhlM bIr KyqM ] bhy SsqR AsqRM ncy BUq pRyqM ]70]297]
transliteration: Bhayo Ouch Kalaahalan Beer Khetan|| Bade Shastra Astran Nachaa Bhoot Pretan||70||297||
translation: There was terrible uproar of warrior; the arms and weapons were struck and the ghosts and fiends danced.70.297.

gurmukhi: PrI Dop pwiek su KMfy ibsyKM ] qury quMd qwjI Bey BUq ByKM ]
transliteration: Pharidhop Paaik Su Khande Bisekhan|| Ture Tound Taajibhae Bhoot Bhekhan||
translation: Holding the sword, the prominent warriors were fragmented and the high-speed horses ran before the Vaitals in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: rxM rwg b`jy q g`jy BtwxM ] qurI q`q n`cy pl`ty BtwxM ]71]298]
transliteration: Ranan Raag Bajje Ta Gadje Bhataanan|| Turitatt Nachche Palatte Bhataanan||71||198||
translation: The war-horns were blown and the warriors thundered; the horses danced and the mighty warriors struck their blows while turning over.71.298.

gurmukhi: ihxMkyq hYvwr gYvwr gwjI ] mt`ky mhwbIr su`By isrwjI ]
transliteration: Hinanket Haivaar Gadvaar Gadjee|| Mattakke Mahaabeer Soubbhe Siraajee||
translation: The horses neighed and the bodies of the mighty warriors writhed;

gurmukhi: kVw ku`t SsqRwsqR b`jy ApwrM ] ncy su`D is`DM auTI SsqR JwrM ]72]299]
transliteration: Kadaa Koutt Shastraastra Bajje Apaaran|| Nache Suddh Siddhan Outhishastra Jhaaran||72||299||
translation: There was clattering of the arms and weapons and the adepts and Yogis, getting intoxicated began to dance with the tune of the weapons.72.299.

gurmukhi: iklMkIq kwlI km`CXw krwlM ] bkXo bIr bYqwl bwmMq jÍwlM ]
transliteration: Kilankeet Kaalikamachchhtaa Karaalan|| Bakyo Beer Baitaal Baamannd Jvaalan||
translation: The dreadful goddesses Kali and Kamakhya shrieked violently and the worriors throwing fire-arms and the Vaitals and Vultures terribly shouts;

gurmukhi: cvI cwvfI cwv causiT bwlM ] krY sRox hwrM bmY jog jÍwlM ]73]300]
transliteration: Chavichaavadichaav Chaousath(i) Baalan|| Darai Sron Haaran Bamai Jog Jvaalan|| 73||300||
translation: The sixty-four Yoginis wearing rosaries saturated with blood enthusiastically threw the flames of Yoga.73.300.

gurmukhi: CurI iCpR CMfY iqmMfY rxwrM ] qm`ky qqwjI BB`ky BtwxM ]
transliteration: Chhurichhipra Chhandai Timandai Ranaran|| Tamakke Tataajibhabhakke Bhataanan||
translation: The sharp knives were thrown in the field, which caused the galloping horses to become furious and the blood of the warriors oozed out and flowed;

gurmukhi: suBy sMdlI boj bwjI ApwrM ] bhy byr ipMgI sumuMdy kMDwrM ]74]301]
transliteration: Soubhe Sandaliboj Baajiapaaran|| Bade Her Pingisoumounnde Kandhaaran||
translation: The horses to good races looked splendid and the Kandhari, Samundari and other types of horses also wandered.74.301.

gurmukhi: qury quMd qwjI auTy k`C A`CM ] k`Cy AwrbI p`b mwno sp`CM ]
transliteration: Ture Tound Taajiouthe Kachchh Achchhan|| Kachchhe Aarbipabb Maano Sapachchhan||
translation: The speedy horses of Kutch state were running and the horses of Arabia, while running looked like the mounts flying with wings;

gurmukhi: auTI DUr pUrM ChI AYx gYxM ] BXo AMD DuMDM prI jwn rYxM ]75]302]
transliteration: Outhidhoor Pooran Chhahiain Gadnan|| Bhayo Andh Dhoundhan Parijaan Rainan||
translation: The dust which arose, covered the sky like this and there was so much mist that the night seemed to have fallen.75.302.

gurmukhi: ieqY d`q DwXo Anwd`q au`qM ] rhI DUr pUrM prI k`t lu`QM ]
transliteration: Itai Datt Dhaayo Anaadatt Outtan|| Rahidhoor Pooran Parikatt Loutthan||
translation: From one side, the followers of Dutt ran and from the second side other people; all atmosphere became dusty and the chopped corpses fell;

gurmukhi: Anwvrq bIrM mhw brq DwrI ] cVXo caup kY quMd n`cy qqwrI ]76]303]
transliteration: Anaavarat Bderan Mahaa Barat Dhdaree|| Chadyo Chaoup Kai Tound Nachchhe Tatdaree||76||303||
translation: The vows of the great vows-observing warriors broke and they enthusiastically mounted on the horses of Tattar and began to dance.76.303.
